docblock.description: Contains classes to manage generating page redirects

tag.name: author
tag.description: Nate Levesque <public@thenaterhood.com> Language: PHP Filename: core_redirect.php

docblock.description: Provides a class for redirecting pages

tag.name: var
tag.description: - the page to redirect from

tag.name: var
tag.description: - the destination to redirect to

tag.name: var
tag.description: - the page to redirect from

tag.name: var
tag.description: - the destination to redirect to

docblock.description: Produces an instance of the class

tag.name: param
tag.description: - the url accessed originally

tag.name: param
tag.description: - the url to redirect to

docblock.description: Provides a simple text output to check if the class was initiated correctly
Applies the redirect to the page

tag.name: param
tag.description: - the type of redirect to use

docblock.description: Performs a 301 (permanent) redirect
Performs a 302 (temporary) redirect
Manages conditionally redirecting pages based on the requested uri and a given uri to redirect from.
docblock.long-description:
Checks to see if the uri requested by the user contains the uri to redirect from, and prepares to perform the redirect if so.

Relies on the redirect class to manage the actual redirecting, this class is primarly an interface to it that deals with the conditional aspect.

tag.name: var
tag.description: - whether or not the redirect needs to occur

docblock.description: Creates an instance of the conditional redirect class and decides whether the redirect will be performed

tag.name: param
tag.description: - a chosen uri to redirect from

tag.name: param
tag.description: - a uri to redirect to

tag.name: param
tag.description: - the uri requested by the user

docblock.description: Applies the redirect to the page if the redirect should happen

tag.name: param
tag.description: - the type of redirect to apply

docblock.description: Contains functions for basic web capabilities such as reading variables from the URL (safely), setting/getting cookies and config options.

tag.description: Nate Levesque <public@thenaterhood.com>

tag.name: copyright
tag.description: Nate Levesque 2013 Language: PHP Filename: core_web.php

docblock.description: Include the config file
Checks to see if the preferred file exists, and if it does returns it, otherwise it returns the secondary file, which ideally should be a file (like an error page) that is guaranteed to exist.

tag.name: param
tag.description: (string): the preferred page to include

tag.name: param
tag.description: (string): the secondary, emergency page to include

tag.name: return
tag.description: (string): the page that should be included

docblock.description: Displays a string with a random greeting and the string the function was called with.

tag.name: param
tag.description: (str): a string, preferably a name

tag.name: return
tag.description: a string with a personal greeting

docblock.description: Built to abstract retrieving config variables, since they're now contained in a class this is just for legacy support until everything else gets moved off of using this function

tag.name: param
tag.description: - the name of a config key to retrieve

tag.name: return
tag.description: the value of the config key

docblock.description: Provides a common interface for picking up variables from the user in a clean way, so that internal variables for pulling pages and otherwise can be managed more easily and sanitation settings are more easily applied site-wide.

tag.name: var
tag.description: (array) - the variables to be contained

tag.name: var
tag.description: (assoc. array) - the variables and assignments

tag.name: var
tag.description: (array) - the variables to be contained

tag.name: var
tag.description: (assoc. array) - the variables and assignments

docblock.description: Iterates through all the variables requested in $request and sets them to their defaults or from the URL/cookie.

tag.name: param
tag.description: (array) - a list of variables to retrieve

docblock.description: Retrieves a value from the associative array.

tag.name: param
tag.description: (str) - the name of a variable to retrieve

tag.name: return
tag.description: - the value of the variable or '' if nonexistant

docblock.description: Dumps the contained session data as an associative array

tag.name: return
tag.description: the session data

docblock.description: Manages sanitizing user input.
docblock.long-description: Currently works only for strings, but adding functions to sanitize other data types is trivial. Retrieving sanitized values from the class involves invoking the __get function with the type, str, arr, bool, etc for whichever sanitation functions are implemented. The sanitization for the requested return is called (returns an empty object if the sanitization can't convert the current one to the requested one).

tag.name: var
tag.description: (str) - the string retrieved

tag.name: var
tag.description: (int) - the maximum allowed length of the string

tag.name: var
tag.description: (str) - the string retrieved

tag.name: var
tag.description: (int) - the maximum allowed length of the string

docblock.description: Constructs an instance of the class containing the original variable and the sanitized variable

tag.name: param
tag.description: (str) - the raw variable contents

tag.name: param
tag.description: (int) - a maximum length for the variable

docblock.description: Returns a sanitized version of the variable.
docblock.long-description: If the requested type is not the same as the actual type, the class will attempt to convert it to the type if possible. Note that list cannot become a string.

tag.name: param
tag.description: - the type of data to return (str, bool, arr, etc)

tag.name: return
tag.description: a sanitized variable

docblock.description: Verify that a string is made of html-safe characters and short enough to fit where it belongs.
docblock.long-description: Basically some simple input sanitizing for nonsecure things.

docblock.description: Return a simple boolean based on the variable
Provides an interface for retrieving variables using a specific method or by searching through each method to find a variable.
Constructs an instance of the class and finds the variable

tag.name: param
tag.description: - the name of the variable

tag.name: param
tag.description: (optional) - the allowed length of the variable

tag.name: param
tag.description: (optional) - the method to use

docblock.description: Defines a class to hold variables for configuration options.
docblock.long-description: All variables are accessible only internally to keep things fairly clean.

docblock.description: variables are documented where they are set lower in the code and so documenting here as per phpdoc standards appears excessive.
Sets the configuration options en-masse.
Returns the value of the requested config key

tag.name: param
tag.description: - the name of the key

tag.name: return
tag.description: the value the key is associated with

docblock.description: Contains classes and functions for retrieving, displaying, and managing blog posts and other aspects of the blog platform

tag.name: author
tag.description: Nate Levesque <public@thenaterhood.com> Language: PHP Filename: core_blog.php

docblock.description: Includes the core_web functions
Creates a list of files in the working directory, sorts and reverses the list, and returns it.
docblock.long-description: Intended for working with blog posts stored as text files with date-coded filenames

docblock.description: Checks the number of files in the current directory and compares it to how many are listed in the current inventory.
docblock.long-description: If the number doesn't match, it returns False.

docblock.description: Regenerates the blog inventory file
Returns a random line of a given file.
docblock.long-description: Used mainly for generating random suggestions for additional blog posts to read.

tag.name: param
tag.description: - a filename to pull a line from

docblock.description: Generates and displays a list of additional 'suggested' blog posts.
docblock.long-description: Right now picks them randomly, but in the future might rely on a better algorithm.

tag.description: (int): how many to generate and display

tag.name: param
tag.description: (string): a tag or tags to use for generating suggestions
